TextView.android:text: What is sudoku?\10In classic sudoku, the objective is to fill a 9×9 grid with digits so that each column, each row, and each of the nine 3×3 subgrids that compose the grid (also called boxes, blocks, or regions) contains all of the digits from 1 to 9. The puzzle setter provides a partially completed grid, which for a well-posed puzzle has a single solution. \10This program can solve sudoku puzzles. All you have to do is enter the initial values ​​in the program and let the other values remain zero and click solve.
\10Note: A sudoku can have multiple or unique solution based on the clues and their positions in the grid.
